page.title: 01A Descripti0n Of The Area
page.content: The area consists of the villages of Crowton, Norley, part of Acton Bridge and a relatively modern private housing development called Delamere Park approximately 10km from Northwich. The landscape is mainly low-lying agricultural land drained by streams flowing northwards to the River Weaver, but rising quite steeply in the southwest upto the village of Norley. The B5153 Northwich to Frodsham road goes through Crowton, and a number of small unclassified roads criss-cross the whole area. In Crowton, village life is situated alongside the road, around the church, primary school, village hall, pub,mill and shop. However Norley is more dispersed. The shops and houses are more widely spread, and there is no definite village centre.
